P.title: What is the probability that a woman will be elected as the President of the United States between 2024 and 2030?
P.body:
Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, between January 20, 2025, and January 20, 2031, a woman is inaugurated as the President of the United States. The resolution will be based on the official confirmation of the election results by the United States Electoral College and the subsequent inauguration of the elected individual as President. The individual must identify as a woman and be recognized as such by authoritative media sources. In the event of a dispute over the election results, the question will resolve based on the final decision by the relevant legal authority, such as the Supreme Court of the United States, if applicable. If a woman assumes the presidency through succession, impeachment, or any other means other than being elected and inaugurated for a new term within the specified timeframe, this will not satisfy the resolution criteria.

In the case that the inauguration date is officially changed, the resolution timeframe will be adjusted accordingly. If no woman is inaugurated as President during the specified timeframe, the question will resolve as No.

Q_given_P.title: Given that a woman is elected as the President of the United States between 2024 and 2030, will the United Kingdom have a new Prime Minister by January 1, 2028?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if no woman is elected as the President of the United States between 2024 and 2030. If a woman is elected as the President of the United States within the specified timeframe, then resolves YES if the United Kingdom has a new Prime Minister by January 1, 2028, based on the criteria provided for the change in leadership in the UK. Resolves NO if the criteria for a new Prime Minister in the UK are not met by the specified date.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that between 2024 and 2030 a woman is elected as the President of the United States and the United Kingdom has a new Prime Minister by January 1, 2028, what is the probability that Japan's Gross Domestic Product (GDP) will decrease by 5% between 2024 and 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions for the President of the United States and the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom are not met within the specified timeframes. If the conditions are met, then the resolution criteria for Japan's GDP decrease by 5% between 2024 and 2030 will be evaluated as per the provided guidelines.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will a woman be elected as the President of the United States between 2024 and 2030 AND will the United Kingdom have a new Prime Minister by January 1, 2028?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if between January 20, 2025, and January 20, 2031, a woman is inaugurated as the President of the United States AND for any reason, a person other than the individual holding the office of Prime Minister of the United Kingdom as of the current date takes office as the new Prime Minister before January 1, 2028. Resolves NO otherwise.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that a woman will be elected as the President of the United States between 2024 and 2030 AND the United Kingdom will have a new Prime Minister by January 1, 2028, what is the probability that France's Gross Domestic Product will increase by more than 3% annually between 2024 and 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions for the President of the United States and the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom are not met within the specified timeframes. If both conditions are met, then resolves as described in the original question for the GDP growth rate of France.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: What is the probability that a woman will be elected as the President of the United States between 2024 and 2030 AND France's Gross Domestic Product will increase by more than 3% annually between 2024 and 2030?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if between January 20, 2025, and January 20, 2031, a woman is inaugurated as the President of the United States AND the annual Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth rate of France increases by more than 3% per annum for each year between January 1, 2024, and December 31, 2030. Resolves NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if between January 20, 2025, and January 20, 2031, a woman is inaugurated as the President of the United States AND the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of Italy, as reported by the International Monetary Fund (IMF) or an equivalent authoritative economic body, shows an increase of more than 3% in real terms (adjusted for inflation) between the fiscal year ending in 2024 and the fiscal year ending in 2030. Resolves NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: What is the probability that a woman will be elected as the President of the United States between 2024 and 2030 AND the United Kingdom will have a new Prime Minister by January 1, 2028 AND Xi Jinping will remain the President of China until 2030?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if, between January 20, 2025, and January 20, 2031, a woman is inaugurated as the President of the United States AND for any reason, a person other than the individual holding the office of Prime Minister of the United Kingdom as of [the date the question was posed] takes office as the new Prime Minister before January 1, 2028 AND Xi Jinping holds the title of President of the People's Republic of China continuously from the date of the question's posting until December 31, 2030. Resolves NO otherwise.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that a woman will be elected as the President of the United States between 2024 and 2030 AND the United Kingdom will have a new Prime Minister by January 1, 2028, what is the probability that the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the United States will increase by more than 3% between 2024 and 2030?
R_given_P_and_Q.body: Resolves N/A if the conditions for a woman being elected as the President of the United States and the United Kingdom having a new Prime Minister by January 1, 2028 are not met. If the conditions are met, then resolves YES if the real Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the United States increases by more than 3% between 2024 and 2030, as specified in the resolution criteria for question Q, and NO otherwise.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: What is the probability that a woman will be elected as the President of the United States between 2024 and 2030 AND the United Kingdom will have a new Prime Minister by January 1, 2028 AND the Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the United States will increase by more than 3% between 2024 and 2030?
P_and_Q_and_R.body: Resolves YES if, between January 20, 2025, and January 20, 2031, a woman is inaugurated as the President of the United States AND for any reason, a person other than the individual holding the office of Prime Minister of the United Kingdom as of [the date the question was posed] takes office as the new Prime Minister before January 1, 2028 AND the real Gross Domestic Product (GDP) of the United States, as reported by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) or its successor agency, increases by more than 3% in total between the fourth quarter of 2024 and the fourth quarter of 2030, adjusted for inflation and based on chained dollars with a reference year that is consistent with the one used by the BEA in 2023. The percentage increase will be calculated using the annualized real GDP figures for the specified quarters. The resolution will be based on the first official release of the relevant data by the BEA after the fourth quarter of 2030. If the BEA has ceased to exist or no longer publishes the relevant data, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative and comparable data source available at the time. In the event of a significant revision of historical GDP data that affects the calculation, the resolution will be based on the revised data. If the relevant data is not released by the resolution date due to unforeseen circumstances, the question will resolve as indeterminate.
